title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 ยง 96.4 - Regulations
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 ยง 96.4 - Regulations

State Regulations

Use of the area for fishing shall be subject to the
following regulations: (a) No person
shall swim or bathe at any time in the area. (b) No person shall enter or leave the area
other than via established entrances or exits. (c) No person shall park a vehicle other than
in a designated parking area. (d) No person shall build or maintain a fire other than in a fireplace located in a
park picnic area. (e) No person
shall use alcoholic beverages in the area. (f) No person shall bring a pet of any kind
in the area. (g) No person shall
dispose of trash, waste or other litter other than in receptacles
provided. (h) No person shall
injure, deface, disturb or befoul any part or area of buildings, signs, equipment or other property in the area. (i) No person shall pick, remove, injure or
destroy any tree, flower, fern, shrub, rock or other plant or mineral in the
area. (j) No person shall use
threatening, abusive, insulting or obscene language or perform any obscene or
indecent act. (k) No person shall
engage in, instigate, aid or encourage a contention or fight or assault any
person, throw stones or other missiles or do any act tending to or amounting to
a breach of peace. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6
ยง
96.4

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
